message_1: Let X be the set {1,2,3} and let T be a topology on X. If T consists of X and all subsets of X containing 1, what are the open sets of (X,T)?
message_2:
The topology T consists of the set X and all subsets of X containing 1. So, the open sets of (X, T) are:

1. The empty set ∅ (since every topology must contain the empty set)
2. The whole set X = {1, 2, 3} (since every topology must contain the whole set)
3. The subsets of X containing 1:
   a. {1} (contains only 1)
   b. {1, 2} (contains 1 and 2)
   c. {1, 3} (contains 1 and 3)

So, the open sets of (X, T) are: ∅, {1}, {1, 2}, {1, 3}, and {1, 2, 3}.
